citations.narrative:
The facility has not completed their contingency plan in full to identify who will be responsible for fulfilling the outlined
tasks recognized in their emergency plan. An outlined plan, with a chain of command identified, is necessary to prepare
for unexpected disasters or events, as well as a detailed strategy to address instructions for, but not limited to: animal
evacuation, sheltering-in-place, and backup provisions for husbandry and food/watering supplies, sanitation, and
ventilation. The facility shall develop and document an appropriate contingency plan available for review upon USDA
inspections.
This inspection was a site approval inspection.
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License.
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act.
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
